detail: Overall a good stay for our second visit in 10 years. Ice was super helpful in the restaurant and the location and views are great. The property does however need some investment as aspects of it are a bit tired and in need of tidying up.

We had such a great experience from the check in all the way to the end of check out process . Ying was fabulous along with the staff from Golf cart rides to the staff at the buffet . They all were very attentive . Just remember if you want the hustle bustle busy party hotel or area this one is def not the one. It’s situated more for relaxation and best for couples especially with our own private infinity pool to our private beach area .
Great place to stay, would recommend! Only con is that nothing is that there are no restaurants or coffeeshops that are walkable you need to take a taxi to get anywhere outside of the property.
Friendly staff and beautiful property. Definitely made our honeymoon unforgettable
Amazing location, staff and service!!
Stayed here a couple times over the years. The property is really starting show its age. Still beautiful and a wonderful time
Perfect
Friendly staff and beautiful property. Definitely made our honeymoon unforgettable
Amazing location, staff and service!!
Stayed here a couple times over the years. The property is really starting show its age. Still beautiful and a wonderful time
Perfect

Really enjoyed my 3 night stay here. The staff are all super friendly. The villas are very uniquely designed, providing a memorable stay. Breakfast was amazing. Looking forward to coming back someday soon.
The rooms were dreadful and rundown. Food below average. The beach and staff were lovely though
We loved everything about the property! The food was great, the rooms were awesome, the resort setting and private beach were beautiful, the staff was so kind and hospitable!
We arrived at hotel on time, but the room not available at 3 p.m., so we need to wait around 30 minites until the room OK.

Fantastic service. The staff were friendly and charming at all times. The setting is stunning and facilities are great. The food in the main restaurant is adequate, but could be better for the price. My only criticism relates to the structure of the buildings and rooms. Refurbishment could be done to improve the surroundings.

Beautiful property but it does need some attention on the maintenance front. Our plunge pool wasn’t as clean as it could be, it was missing a one time clean but more of a deep clean. Staff were lovely and very attentive.

This hotel is so old and the property is worn down so much. Totally different from the photos. bedding, sleepers towels and sofas are also gross and old feeling. breakfast food quality is terrible, the beach in front of the hotel is disgusting!
The property and staff were amazing. I would not have wanted to stay anywhere else in Phuket...the moment I left i promised myself that I would return.
If privacy is your goal, this hotel is a fitting place.
If your goal is for privacy, then this is a fitting place.

Could definitely tell it was very nice when it first opened, but as of our visit (Nov 2019) we could see some (minor) rusts and cracks in the buildings. Otherwise, the private pool water was clean, and the breakfast was good. If you are planning on sight seeing around town, this is probably not the place as getting into Patong takes about 30 minutes. Even within the facility, if you are staying in the "high bay" area, you definitely need to call for the cart to move anywhere (the beach, breakfast, lobby...). We had a good time chilling by the private pool. Keep in mind that the pool villas are built with the open space concept--the pro is that the view is excellent, and the con is that the privacy is not entirely guaranteed.

Fabulous resort with amazing service. We loved our High Bay villa with its views - next time we are going to try the beach access villa. Breakfast spread was also delicious, extensive and varied from day to day.
Hotel staff were friendly and responsive. My pregnant wife and 18 month year old enjoyed it so much much that we will be back next year again.

Beautiful design of the property exterior. Stayed in the High Bay pool suite and woke up to the view of the bay every morning. Service was prompt and professional throughout our stay. Room service orders arrive within 30 mins of ordering, buggy arrives within a minute. The Guest Services Director, Fon, came to bid us farewell at the lobby as we were checking out. Thanks for the amazing stay!

This was one of the best hotel/resort experiences I've had anywhere in the world. If Phuket wasn't beautiful enough already, the Naka Phuket makes me want to return to Thailand just to visit this property again. The entire staff is super helpful and nice. Breakfast is amazing. Plenty of western and local choices. Note that some rooms require walking up a lot of steps. If you have mobility issues, consider requesting a room that is more easily accessible. With its private beach, we didnt NEED to go anywhere. If you're debating between the different areas in Phuket, especially Patong, know that Patong is very busy. The nightlife is wild. If you want this, great. But I was much more happy staying away from it all yet having access to it by 15 min shuttle or taxi ride. Also note, if you stay at this property, you're not going to walk anywhere. The hotel is secluded and the area, along with the property, is very hilly. The hotel provides a tuk tuk to take you anywhere you need within the property, and you will take a taxi or the hotel shuttle to go anywhere else. Someone commented in a previous review about a drainage pipe feeding into the water near the private beach. The review had me second guessing this place, but it was very small and hardly noticeable...plus far enough away that I didn't have concerns about sewage or anything. Bottom line... The Naka is top notch! If its in your budget, even if you have to stretch a bit, its well worth it!

Nice outside and tired inside. Pouring rain during breakfast and water flooded in the restaurant, funny scene was when the staff brought us to the best table in the restaurant but forgot to take care the whole table and chair was wet and gesturing me to sit down :-)

The resort staff was great and very helpful and friendly for the entire stay. The room was clean and private with great views. The breakfast spread was excellent with a lot of variety. We utilized the in room dining several times and the service was quick. Visited the Spa and selected one of their packages offered and the experience was great and felt it was good value for the money.

The staffs are extremely helpful, also very friendly and always carry a smile. Breakfast buffet is very nice, they do offer a wide range of cuisines ( Chinese, western, and Thai of course). Good English communication skills. Overall a very pleasant experience at Naka Phuket and will definitely re-visit. One thing to note is that transportation to Patong is not as convenient compare to other hotels and villas in the same area, I think the villa is more suitable for people who plan to rent a car and travel around but if not, one way taxi to Patong is around THB 440 (as for Aug 2019).
amazing hotel, must book the high bay villa for better view.
Service was great. Food is average. Nice beach. Good view. Only downside is need more light in the room!!!!!!!

Normally when I check out I can take shampoo button or shower gel button that I use it . back to home but here is can’t take it! That is meaning will put again to back to another guess? I paid to much for spent time to relax at here but I found that I am disappointed for small thing there is very stingy for guess??I Would not recommend to my friends to come to here.
Amazing villas, very good and courteous staff. Well located property.
amazing hotel! Ultimate privacy and luxury

We have spent 7 days and 6 nights in the one bedroom deluxe sea view villa. Pros: 1) great location. Only 15 minutes drive to Patong area 2) have a small private beach 3) breakfast runs till 11am. Cons: 1) The hotel room lacks maintenance on its hardware. Lots of missing tiles in the pool. Both my boyfriend and I have a small cut caused by it. The toilet seat was so broken and tilted that you are literally sitting on the bowl itself. The outdoor bathtub’s switch to shower was broken. 2) there was very little privacy. The outdoor bath was totally visible to the villas one level up. There was no cover nor anything. The staff has suggested for us to put on swimsuit whilst bathing. 3) you would expect top notch and personalised services provided by such a luxurious resort. However, the staffs were far from any of the other JW Marriott’s quality. We have spent 7 days there and none of the staff at the restaurant remembered us, nor would they greet the guests with a smile. Check in staff were not very professional either. I have asked for a late check out upon arrival and the staff said they could only give us a confirmation one day in advance. However, we went out at 4ish pm and came back at around 1am. No answer was found and we had to take the initiative to contact the front desk. 4) housekeeping did a rather sketchy job. Used cup were left on coffee table. Insect repellent was left on the sofa. Didn’t refill empty tissue box. Have bugs bite on the bed at night.
Amazing. Service and reception was very welcoming. Very quite location. Perfect for the relax get away.
Very beautiful. I don’t think any other place beautiful like this.

Great aesthetics and decent value for money, given the beautiful views and space in villa. Housekeeping can step up their game and pay more attention to details, guest services can be more accommodating to needs of guests.
Quite old building. The staff the Sky Bar very ruled. Definitely will not come back again.
The food for in villa bbq wasnt that good. However, the customers service in general is the best I have ever experienced.
Awesome property with great and creative spaces The units are very well designed and large

I kinda like to leave a 4.5 star for this stay, lets start with the cons, as previous review by other tourist, seems like their check-in SOP intend to misleading us to stay in a poor view room until people get mad and negotiate with them. Btw, the problem are solved eventually. Next will be the pros, the view definitely worth the price, especially when you are a sea view + private pool person. Even though having the same problem with other resort, restaurant are limited, and charging unreasonable price, however, the food quality and services are up to standard and deserve a 5 star review. Overall, I'm happy with the stay and will going back pretty soon.
Amazing resort and staff are extremely helpful and nice! I recommend this resort to anyone who wants a private 5 start resort.
Very nice villa with fair privacy. But too much bugs. And the shuttle they provided is too bumpy and not comfy.
The Naka Phuket is the Best hotel ever! From my experienced. The private pool is large size.
It was grate but the transportation inside the resort was very bad, uncomfortable buggy. And there were very limited shuttles to patong.

Room was clean and nice. Service was prompt when requests were made. Our trip was for an anniversary. Unfortunately that aspect of our trip was not emphasized or recognized. Our arrival was at 12:00 PM but were asked to wait for room for 3 hours even though early checkin was requested and it was made known as n advance we were traveling large distance and would be quite exhausted on arrival. None of the restaurants had AC. Property looks a bit tired, as though it has not had significant up keep. Clear signs of climate and weather eroding buildings. Nice design concept over all but some aspects are not functional. Poor use of space at pool on entrance to the apartment. The area has no store nearby. Staff was pleasant and tried hard to keep us happy. I felt there were a number of employees that worked very hard to do their job well, and another set that kind of just stood around and avoided eye contact so as to avoid being asked for anything. Over all we enjoyed our time and it was relaxing. The private beach is nice and the views are very nice as well.
All around wonderful experience. Bit expensive given the market but the staff were exemplary. Nothing bad to say at all really. Food amazing. Privacy valued.
Hotel with Great view, awesome staff.

Everything about this stay was 10/10. We were truly amazed by the views from our room, the generosity & kindness of the staff and the quality of stay overall. 1000% recommend this to anyone and everyone interested with absolutely no hesistation!!

Amazing staff so friendly and helpful. The room could be little better with little bit effort.. such as table in pool area because ypu can feel the emptiness over there.. thank you for the amazing treatment

The overall stay was excellent! It was the honeymoon trip for me and my wife and it was so good that we have extended our stay for 3 more nights. Staffs were helpful since before we even arrive and through out our stay. They helped us arrange this honeymoon trip and gave us a cake and champagne on arrival. Specially there was a manager which helped my wife to arrange for those nail cleaning thing, much appreciated! We have also tried every restaurant at the hotel and they are not bad, each of those restaurants serve different food, the best one we had however was the room service! Definitely worth the stay, i would recommend it to anyone!
spacious villa, minimal bare design, free minibar, fantastic breakfast buffet
Beautiful location and views . Buildings are getting a little warn down. Staff are great.
Great service and buffet breakfast. Nice quiet place with Olympic sized pool. The private pool and private beach make it great for kids! Beautiful rooms as well with stunning views.
It is very private and has a nice view of the ocean. Service is quick and attentive

What a beautiful stay, beautiful hotel and a beautiful staff. i loved everything about the hotel. the villa was incredible and the view was breathtaking. the service was extremely unique from the first day and helpful. Thank you for making our trip amazing.
The most incredible private beach villas, and amazing service from the staff. Truly the Gem of Phuket!

aesthetically pleasing architecturally. we value privacy and our villa was unfortunately directly above the restaurant. there was a wedding happening the same weekend we stayed which impacted our level of enjoyment. also, the air conditioning in our villa didn’t seem to be working properly as we routinely woke up due to our bedroom being far warmer than we had set the thermostat to.
the matchbox suites are beautiful and the property is great. staff are very pleasant and accommodating where possible.

Beautiful property. Excellent location. The breakfast at this place is better than any I have ever had and the villas are gorgeous with their private pools. Stay here if you wanna be close to Pag beach but not in the middle of the Pating madness.
The Naka Phuket is a fantastic place to stay. The pool villas were great, and the service and food were excellent. Definitely going to go back the next time we are in Phuket.
All facilities needed for family holiday or couples are perfect. The food taste excellent. I can spend 24 hours in the resort, no need to go out.

One of the most exciting places I have ever stayed in. The pool villa was very romantic and relaxing and spacious for me and my wife The shore was great and clean and good for a walk. The only problem was the way to the naka phuket was a little bit difficult. Another problem was the jacuzzi was not working and it was not a bug deal because I have the pool.

The WiFi does not work in our room and we need to call staff to repair it when we first come. The staff should check it before let us enter room as 5 stars. After checking and repairing WiFi, the staff reports to the front desk that we can an extra lady living in our room and want to charge us extra fee for extra person. I am so confused and we only have two people living here and I have to recall the staff again and again to inform them there is no extra lady! It’s a bit scary as wel and unprofessional for treating customer like this. For dinner, some food r missing and need to call staff to deliver the missing food again. On the other day, a staff suddenly come to our room and say we booked a car... but we didn’t and I was sleeping. The shuttle bus to Patong is also late and need us to wait 15 mins more for the bus BUT the shuttle is “Tuk tuk”.... I expect the shuttle bus is a proper car for 5 stars hotel. Overall the design of the hotel is well but kind of old probably due to the building structure without the protection coat. The staff are undertrained and made a lot mistakes in 3 days. For checking out, they asked us to wait 5 mins for checking the room. After that, no one ask us to leave until a staff realised they forgot to inform us... the service is poor as 5 stars and I expect a lot more due to the Price and rating. Not recommend to stay here because there are better choices with this price.
Everything is perfect. Meet my expectation. For sure I’ll be back again

The hotel is pretty well maintained and good privacy. The architecture is interesting with a nice ocean view in my room. Very good for having a quiet vocation. However, services are not attentive. Upon arrival, there were 2 other guests arrived 10 minutes later than me, but they were being served first. No one explained where to have breakfast, after charging my credit card for deposit, I was sent to the buggie, that's it. One evening, I was asking for the buggie from their restaurant back to room, end up waited for 25 minutes as the request being forgotten. I understand sometimes it might be several requests at the same time, but there were not many guests. The last evening, when I was taking shower, the reception called to remind me to check out on the next day, the attitude was rather unpleasant. Probably because it took half minute for me to pick up the call, but I was in shower ! Also, who would forget the check out date? I had informed the reception upon arrival that I booked the pick up at 1pm, so it's not possible for me to stay behind in the room over time. It's not necessary to 'remind ' at all if they pay attention.

Everything was amazing about The Naka Phuket. They went out of their way with every experience, from service to the breakfast buffet to their free shuttles. I can't think of a single moment when I was disappointed with this resort. Truly breathtaking views to match their 5 star service. Thailand and it's people are wonderful but this was definitely the highlight of our trip, and likely the best experience in all our travels.
The property is great and it was a joy to stay there. The shuttle to Patong also made it easy to go back/forth different areas.

Noisy, run down, badly designed. Building site next door, lots of patchy maintentenance work going on all the time throughout the resort, planks of wood and materials left lying around on walkways and hanging from roofs. 73 steps to our villa, walkway lighting to our villa not working at night until we complained, then it was repaired. Fell through rotten wood plank by the pool. Music from restaurant woke us up each morning and played on until night: the bass was so disruptive, no chance of a lie in. Two different music tracks played against each other all day. Noise from building repairs and nearby condo sight throughout the day. Cement walkways & walls peeling and cracking, steps uneven, woodwork rotten and warped everywhere, villa door all warped, run down. They made is sit in the back of diesel trucks in the heat to get around the resort & to go to Patong, which is quite a drive. No water offered free by the pool. Tiny gym, ugly high rise building in the resort. 3 weddings took place in 5 days: noise noise & more noise. Awful, not 5 stars at all!

This hotel is amazing and probably the best hotel I've ever stayed in! It was absolutely perfect and what we were looking for. I cannot speak highly enough of this wonderful place. From the moment we got to the hotel, everyone was so kind and helpful, went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect for our stay. Our room was spacious, beautiful, modern. The pool was so beautiful and relaxing. The breakfast spread in the morning was so extravagant, breakfast was practically my biggest meal of the day because I wanted to try everything they had. The location is secluded with a private beach, definitely perfect for a more quiet and relaxing vacation, but still close enough to Patong Beach to explore the crazy city/party scene if you felt like it (and they have a free buggy service that takes you to Patong Beach if you want). Overall, this is the most amazing hotel and would come back in a heart beat!
The hotel has the potential to be amazing but the service experienced was less than 2 star and the food was average. It is a shame as the hotel could be really beautiful

The property has a bit of everything - you have a private beach, romantic dinner option available on the beach, the rooms are staggered on the hill side (we asked for one of the highest rooms for total privacy), the infinity / plunge pool is amazing from top of the hill - you can see patong beach across the sea. Furthermore, there are (paid) shuttles / cars to the airport and patong beach etc. This was quite convenient.

Naka was everything that I wanted it to be. I was looking for a private space where I can relax, be poolside, and focus. Shuttle service throughout the resort was super helpful. Staff was attentive. One thing that I learned was not to leave out any food or drinks. Had some ants crawl in, but it was easily cleaned. I realized I am surrounded by nature everywhere I look so I'm not surprised, though. Wasn't a big issue. Naka: not sure if you see this, but I think what would help would be to install a PA system, or a way to communicate to people knocking at the front door of the villa. Unless I was clueless and couldn't figure out the tech, I had to literally had to exit the actual room and open the door to my villa for room service or housekeeping. Would be better for me to push a button that would unlock the front door to the villa. But, that's SUPER MINISCULE to the value of the property. Let's be clear, tons of people on online asked me where I was and for the location b/c they were super jealous. Would I stay there again? 100000000000%!
Thank you very much really enjoyed our stay here and I would do it again soon
Location is great. Food fantastic. Room with outdoor pool, bath and shower were fantastic. The view was amazing and the service very helpful. Only down side was the exterior of building looked tired.
Very friendly and helpful staff! And very nice villa
Spacious villa with special design. Good for honey moon and for family gey away.

It was an amazing experience for the staying at the hotel. The room and facilities are all true to the pictures shown. As a reminder, the location is really a remote area. However, it should be a place that you spend alot of time inside. August seems to be a windy period, therefore, the big waves stopped us to use the private beach. My son had a small accident and the front desk staff Mook and driver Am took good care of my boy. Thank you them once again.

Electric system didn’t work properly. Air con was out of order on arrival n departure day. Dusty. Wardrobe n cabinets r not functionally closed. Hot water at rain shower was hardly to adjust in balance temperatures. Poor system n structure maintenance
Like the stay and the restaurants in hotel,The private beach makes even better place for a getaway holiday
Hotel is an amazing setup BUT it has weathered from the elements and has not been repaired.

This was a true 5 star experience. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and the private villa pool was great for relaxing after a long day. It was about a 15 minute cab ride to Patong for shopping and a lively nightlife. A map of the resort would have been helpful so we could have walked to different places around the resort without having to call for a ride. I highly recommend this place.

We arrived early and had to wait for our room. Reception had provided us with buggy to go to the restaurant. Also we got free coffees and snacks in business room while waiting. The private 1 bedroom villa is stunning. The best view is from room next to The Meka restaurant. We also had in villa BBQ and I was just perfect. With lobster and king prawns - the stay was ideal.

The hotel is really nice and clean. The view is absolutely amazing. The private pool is nice. The hotel staff are very sweet that they gave my friends and I a big surprise by sending us a bottle of champagne and a cake for us to celebrate our friendship anniversary. One thing I don’t like about the hotel room is that the rooms are separated into different floor.

Amazing sea view with balcony. Infinity pool and 2 showers (one outdoor). One to two room service checks to ensure towels etc were stocked. 24 hour pick up from villa to the on site restaurant, sky lounge etc. 24 hour in room dinning available. Fantastic from check in to check out. Even on days we had trips booked they organised little packed lunches as we would miss our usual breakfast.

Visited for a long weekend getaway with my partner. Staff were amazing from the get-go - early check in upon early flights arrival, well escorted and introduced, prompt buggy service and room service, room make up and turn down. Very pleased with the team to make such a wonderful experience for couples. If there’s one thing I would add would be that the property is showing signs of ageging. There were a trail of ants at the patio, the pool was clean but the tiles and water proofing are getting old. That said, these are things that can be resolved easily if management decides to invest for the long haul. Will be returning soon!
Overall is good but too many dead insect without cleansing.
Beautiful villa, good breakfast spread, excellent service. Only disadvantage is the taxi fare of abt 500baht in or out since there are only 3 timings for shuttle service to shopping area in Patong.

Extremely large area for a good relaxing stay. Design and construction of the entire Space is well thought of. Bedroom situated right at the front , away from all the electronics and bathroom to ensure serenity and a good nights sleep. Living room structured in the middle making it accessible to bedroom and bathroom. Wardrobe area near the bathroom is perfect after showers. Bathroom right at the end followed by the outdoor showers are amazing. The large pool beside has a very good view of the entire beach. The whole premise surrounded by nature is surreal.

A big thank you to Patty for the anniversary surprise! Our stay was amazing, the service was impeccable, the amazing view from our room, the private beach, and so many things... We could stay in the villa and stare at the sky, listen to the birds and waves all day, everyday! The one thing to be improved is the drive uphill at night; would be a lot safer with some street lights. Thank you Naka Phuket for the beautiful stay!
LOVE this resort! Staff was friendly and helpful. The room I stayed had an awesome view and overall experience was pleasant.

Fabulous facilities, especially if your room is down near the private beach. We had a room with beach access with wonderful views and very quiet except for the sound of the waves gently rolling on the sand below. The resort is relatively new and modern, and over the next years will need ongoing maintenance to keep the rooms etc in top condition. Also worth mentioning that the breakfast is outstanding with extensive food options.

Huge rooms with fantastic levels of both comfort and equipment including interactive TV, large beds with fantastic views and of course the largest individual infinity pool I've ever seen. The infinity pool down at the beach is also a fantastic feature. The hotel is an architetcs marvel but to our mids looked a little asutere with way too much mass concrete although done in an effort to appear artistic. Breakfast at the property is amazing with huge choice. The hot food is kept edible and not dried out as can be the case with buffet style breakfast. If you like oriental style breakfast this is the place for you. My only criticisms are; rooms are very poorly lit at night and the hotel has no SOUL. There is no real centre to the hotel and nowhere for guests to feel they are part of a community as one gets in other hotels where lobby and public facilities are centered. The property is so spread out transport is used to bus guests from room to restaurant etc leaving one feeling a bit alone.

Great place to have a chill out if you’re looking for a holiday that is away from the hustle & bustle. The Naka Phuket has its own private beach hence you wouldn’t have to “squeeze” with other tourists for a spot to enjoy the sunrise. The buggy service is very prompt and staff is friendly.

The resort was stunning. It made for a perfect hideaway holiday if you a looking for a peaceful break. A few things to note. Pool is amazing. Staff are extremely friendly. Villas are stunning - some not as private as other depending on location. Good gym. Restaurant if decent. The beach is sandy but as you enter the water it is a rock bottom mostly so not the best for swimming. We stayed in a Beach Access Pool Villa, room number 5/1 - if you are staying in one of these villas 5/1 is a little more private then 5/2 but both good - the we stay again we might opt for one of the villas high up with a sunset view.

Nicely laid out property in a quite bay around 10mins drive from Patong. The rooms on the hillside offer beautiful views over the resort and the bay out to sea. The villas are very spacious, the pools are awesome. Some rooms and pools offer more privacy than others! I would have been annoyed to have a room directly next to the roads around the resort as all guests can look into your bedroom or on your pool deck. But I was lucky and had complete privacy. Unfortunately the resort is loosing points in the maintenance departement, it is very obvious that they need to spend money for lots of exterior touch ups very soon. Otherwise the high price is not justified anymore. Also a little more English language skills for the staff would be helpful, even the ladies at the reception only got half of my requests. I know I'm in Thailand but this is an international Hotel trying to attract guests from all over the world and in this case English is still essential!
We really enjoyed the stay. Beautiful private views with close proximity to night life

Our stay at the Naka was magical! We loved the property, the villas, service, beach and pools. We will definitely be back. Ms. Fon the guest services director went out of her way to make our honeymoon at Naka truly special and we are incredibly grateful for her and all the staff’s hospitality!
One of the best hotels i have stayed in. It is highly recommended.
Amazing service from staff. Warm and always provided alternatives.
Breathtaking view, respectful and accommodating staff, no inconveniences, excellent service.

The service was first class, the staff were helpful and obliging to all our guests needs. This is more for those that want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Phuket, but the hotel does provide a free shuttle to the main centre of Patong beach, which helps! We would definitely stay again.
A lot of ants but We loved the hotel , it was beautiful , we loved breakfast . Very secluded . Romantic !!!
Amazing resort but quite isolated from activities around Phuket

Staff were pleasant but the villas are in need of an upgrade. Stayed in a one BR pool villa and pool area was tired looking at best. There was also an ant trail in the room. Overall still a pleasant and relaxing stay but I am not sure it was worth the money paid.
Simply amazing, really liked the room hotel staff and the private pool. I would like to go back to this hotel.
The rooms are designed so amazingly, it feels awesome. The views from the room are unmatched! Location is great as it is away from the crap of Patong beach area.
This villa was a true retreat beautiful views and accommodation, staff is extremely freindly and helpful. This was for my wife and I's honeymoon couldn't have picked a more perfect place.

The resort is generously laid out and prioritises privacy for each and every villa. The villas themselves were the wow factor for me, superb modernist architecture you don't expect to see in Asia necessarily but it is done so well. Each villa is a steel and glass box encircled with double curtaining in recessed tracks (its all about the details) and loads of polished basalt and light timber to add warmth to the brooding colour palate. The villas were large and well appointed. The family favourite was the private infinity pool adjacent to each villa. It was lined in dark plum coloured Morano glass tiles - again, details. Even the minibar is topped up daily at no charge. Then there's the views from every vantage point. The other facilities and meals from the different restaurants were all of a high standard. Breakfasts were spectacular and generous - among the best we've had anywhere. The staff were superb too, always smiling and helpful quickly learning and anticipating your coffee preferences, drink choices etc. Amazing place for the ambulant, exhausted or lovers of great design.
Very beautiful hotel, good design, Great breakfast But not nearby patong beach
We will never forget our amazing experience at the Naka. The staff were so friendly and thoughtful at every turn. Our villa was immaculate and heavenly. The food and drink were absolutely delicious.

Was celebrating my hushand's birthday at Phuket over the weekend. Staff were very friendly & attentive to our needs. The hotel gave us a complimentary cake & one of the rooms with a good sea view & high floor. There are free shuttle transfer to Patong area as well. Breakfast & infinity pool was superb! Overall we had such a memorable & wonderful experience at Naka Phuket & will definitely hope to go back one day! :)

1) What struck me most was the level of service provided. Some examples of how the hotel staff impressed me was: always on hand to offer help, especially with ferrying us around the resort; took the initiative to offer to arrange our transport back to the airport. 2) My room (pool villa) was large, clean, comfortable and well furnished. The bedroom overlooks the sea which is a great view to wake up to. There are 4 different ways to take a shower. The private pool was really lovely too, though mine had a tree that partially obscured the sea view. 3) Location is a bit inaccessible given it is remotely nestled next to the beach. However, the resort provides free shuttle service to Patong beach 3 times a day (and return trip twice daily). 4) Facilities are good overall. They have a main restaurant (with delicious buffet breakfast with daily variation), a sky lounge with view overlooking the entire villa and bay, a resort beach and a main pool just in front of it. All in all, it is an idyllic place to relax and I check out today with a slight longing.

We loved this place! Beautiful grounds and rooms. One thing- it would be nice to alternate the song played in the front desk area. It drove me nuts for the few times I was up there and can't be pleasant for those who work there and hear the same song on loop constantly.
Beautiful tranquil location, great service, excellent rooms, private pool and free bar fridge. Perfect for honeymooners or a couple's retreat!

The Naka Phuket is a nice designed hotel, we stayed in a pool villa which offers a 270 degree wide sea view from our room, it is breathtaking; however, the maintanance is not very good that wooden part of the villa seems very old and weathered, there are ants in the bathroom everyday. For the transport, it is in the hill and taxi drivers charged us above average price because of isolated location, around 500 THB from Patong to hotel. The hotel must consider seriously to add a night returned shuttle bus around 9:30 or 10 pm.

This hotel now has a bit of an identity crisis, it was clearly build for chic couples, everything is 'designer', but for me good design means it also has to perform its function well, if it looks good then so much the better.Several things on this hotel are badly designed in that they are not fit for purpose. The outside bath for example is made from stone slabs, with what looked like some very sharp edges. (therefore i didn't try it!) The ousdide shower (which I did try was like standing under a broken pipe! - not pleasant at all. In the evening some of the lighting was so dim you had to use a torch! Now I'm a huge advicate of mood lighting - but surely you have to be able or see where toy are going? This hotel is made with a lot of concrete and I mean a lot! The trouble is, they are now discovering that the older concrete gets - the worse it looks, and on a dull wet day the place does look like a prison camp! This is not a place for kids yet they are introducing kids clubs to attract families. This will actually put of the very people it was designed for. IT It is also not cheap compared to other similar properties in the area
Beautiful view Clean Hospitality of staff Value for money
Everything was perfect .. amazing experience with total privacy
The room was big but the light is not enough. Also, there are not enough plugs. However, all staff was polite and helpful.

Warm staff, great food. Very clean and very nice room. The view from 2bedroom pool villa is very stunning but part of the curtain blocks the corner view. Bathroom floor has no slope, the water doesn't drain easily. I like the scent of shower gel, great wifi speed. The room is quite dark at night.

It was my 2nd time in this hotel. Basically, the location, architectural, hotel facilities are very good, just 45 minutes from the airport, has a private beach, special architectural design of the hotel. You will have a surprise when you first came here. However, the staff or the service needs much more improvement. One day, we went out in the morning at 10am, came back to the hotel at 4pm. We were surprised to see that the room was not yet cleaned. We call the house-keeping why it was so, they had no apology but said that we had not called for cleaning up. My god, this is a 5-star hotel and you know when we left hotel as we ordered the car from your hotel, you should come to clean up the room automatically when we were out. Then the house-keeper said they will come one hour later, but it turned out to be 2 hours later when I saw them arrived. One more thing, we are living in a 2-bedroom villa. the bedroom downstair is in poor condition, it is small. Of course, there is no bath tub! but no shower cabinet, when we are having shower, the floor of the toilet will be wet. I think the hotel should spend more time and money to improve the condition.

We stayed at The Naka for 4 nights as our honeymoon. Our room had an amazing view. Also, Every staffs was so kind and nice. Breakfast buffet was great, foods were delicious(especially eggs!!!!) We orders some foods as a room services. Try their seafood chowder. IT WAS AMMMAAAAAZZZZIIIINNNGGG Beds were really comfort and housekeepers did very good jobs.

This was our second time at The Naka Phuket. Room designs are very convenient, views from the bedroom are next to none and private pool is just what we needed. There is some room for improvements, of course. Better choice of pastry at breakfast would be appreciated. Massage and SPA are waaay overprice. Poor choice of channels makes a large TV in a beautiful living room quite useless. Anyway, The Naka offers beautifully designed and very well-maintained villas with private pools, amazing views, good and fairly priced food and highly professional and friendly staff. We'll be coming back for more.

From the moment we arrived the staff was super nice and ready to cater to any of our needs. They had provided us with an amazing room location since they knew it was our honeymoon. The resort itself is very peaceful and has a private beach that you can access. Most of the units also have a private infinity pool. Highly recommend to the spa treatment at the hotel as well. Breakfast was a buffet style with tons of variety of food. All staff members always had a smile on their face and willing to help with anything. High caliber resort and we would definitely revisit and stay there.

The NAKA resort in Phuket is by far the best resort I have ever stayed at in my entire life. The staff there went above and beyond to accommodate us. We had the best time. The vila was huge and perfect. The private pool in our villa was very big. The room had the perfect view of the ocean. The staff was just amazing. If a perfect hotel exists it would be the Naka in Phuket and I'm dead serious!
Very nice and friendly hotel. Secluded not located in a busy area. The only con I would have for this hotel is the language barrier and it was ants in our room constantly.

We have had a great time at this resort. Great view from our room facing the west. The hotel facilities are clean and neat and their staff are all very friendly. The resort is located in a quiet corner which is only a ten minute drive away from Patong Beach where you can experience the hectic tourist spot with the beach, water sports, bars, clubs and a giant shopping mall.

Staying here for a wedding, the villas had been great gathering places for groups with their private pools. Its simple design also allowed the guest to focus well on the sky, sun, water and temperature of this place. The beach, restaurant, lawn and beaches are very friendly and welcoming for guests and families to use. Staffs are great but seems that or in special occasions there is a slightly lack of attentions from the staffs to the guests.

I had an amazing experience at the Naka. The hotel is beautiful and has very modern architecture. It has its own private beach and Infiniti pool. The spa was great too. The hotel staff was ok and a little slow, but other than that the experience was fantastic. It was such a magical and peaceful hotel. Would recommend 100 percent to anyone else. I needed to stay until 6 pm on check our day because my 25 hour flight to the United States was leaving late. They charged me 172 dollars. Overall, it was a picturesque and wonderful hotel.
Great place to stay! Service and accommodation was great. Only downside (or upside?) was the area is abit isolated from anywhere in Phuket.
We went to explore Phuket but did not have the heart to leave the hotel. Breathtaking views and amazing service.
The hotel locate in very quiet place the Vila that I stay have amazing view on the bay The rooms are not so private Cleaning is ok can get better Breakfast is good Staff is good
Nice vacation. Life is peachful for a couple day. Will come back again soon.
Lovely spot, good distance from Patong. They fill your mini bar up each day for free. The staff is lovely. No complaints at all, air conditioner worked well and pool was perfect temperature.
I love at time with my family. /:: Food /:: Activity /:: Room /:: Staff

When you arrive hotel, you would find the lobby being so stunning as it is a half opened area, you can take a look at the whole villa at lobby which was an eye-opening experience. You have your whole privacy which is perfect for couples

My wife and I checked in to this $400 per night luxury hotel expecting to have a great time here. We arrived to the hotel around 2pm. During our check-in, the staffs told us we need to wait till five PM in order for the room to be ready. We waited and was not able to check in around 6pm. The next day we got into an motorcycle accident just outside of the hotel main road, we have told the front desk and no one offered any help or support. My wife and I had to call a taxi to the hospital and the police station afterward all by ourselves. The hotel never asked us how we are or provided any support during the next two days of our stay. At the last day of check out, I have to ask three different staffs and the hotel manager to extend my stay due to the injury of the accident. finally the manager agreed to let us have a late check out by 2:30pm. The overall experience of this hotel staff was not pleasant. I will not recommend nor choose to stay here again!
Hotel staff are nice, you can have message in the room. Wonderful seaview
It was paradise! Except for the tiny ants/bugs and mosquitos, but that's pretty much unavoidable in Thailand! It was worth every penny and we're so glad we chose the Naka.
Breath taking view. Friendly & helpful staffs with smile always on their faces. Very clean, well organized, quiet. Love the breakfast.

On a two night stay, I stayed in two different rooms. The first had a broken front step directly outside the door, buckling floorboards, and lots of bugs (due to one broken sliding door). Due to the door issues, I was moved to another room. This one was better in terms of maintenance, but overall the property needs work. Also, housekeeping will keep ringing the door bell and yelling at you until you go outside to speak with them, even when the do-not-disturb sign is displayed. I found this irritating. There was also a power outage for several hours one night due to the onsite generating breaking down, and no offer of any sort of compensation by management.

The Naka is one of the most frustrating places we've stayed at. It could be fantastic but fails to live up to its promise, mainly due to the abysmal service. It's a great spot, set in its own bay and beach (if you don't mind the rock pools, not the easiest to swim in). We liked the modern design of the villas but the upkeep is poor and they look tired in places. The finishes you would expect from something that promotes itself as a five star hotel are missing. Corners have been cut and it shows. Also, there are many concrete steps to the villas, and many of the lights had gone, making it dangerous to walk at night. There were not enough staff and many of those working were poorly trained. Simple requests like an additional sun lounger were refused (despite charging us for an extra person in our villa). Restaurant reservations we were told had been made hadn't been, which we only found out after an hour drive to the restaurant. It was my birthday during our stay and my partner had arranged surprises via the hotel, which they spoilt by asking him questions about on two occasions in front of me. It shows the lack of attention to detail and highlights the poor training on customer service you would expect from a high-end hotel which should be as standard at this price point. The exception would be the restaurant staff at breakfast who were friendly and the breakfast selection is good. Management need to raise their game. Until then avoid the Naka Hotel.

Stayed at one bed villa for 4 nights. Great facility, reasonable price, olympic size swimming pool, great gym with good gx programs and weight lifting equipment but no Family Mart or not for people who like crowded environment
The setting, the staff, the views, the food, the services...they were all top notch at the naka. We will definitely be back for another stay!

The Naka Phuket does it right. We traveled here for our honeymoon and could not have picked a better place. The resort is off the path and secluded which adds to the ambiance and charm. The rooms were luxurious, spacious, and provided a very homey feel. They are cleaned twice a day and supplies are restocked. Overlooking the ocean, the view from the rooms are fantastic. Having a private pool, which bigger than expected, was one of the major draws to Naka and it did not disappoint. The food was great offering a wide variety of both local and nonlocal dishes. The only complaint is that there are tiny ants that are searching for food so don't leave anything around in the rooms. I'd highly recommend Naka to anyone and would love to go back again.
Great property - great food and breakfast buffet. Exceptional service.
I enjoyed the tranquility and quiet surroundings. The environment was conducive for recuperating from work stress.
great time all time
this is the first hotel I can not be late check out for only 1 hour when the hotel is fairly empty
Everything was perfect, rooms were spacious, private and modern, very clean, staff were very helpful.

We had a great time at the Naka Phuket. The Villa is very private and nicely set up.The Sea View Villa had great view of the Andaman Sea with a private pool. The service was excellent and the Buffet Breakfast was very good. Only hope they had more shuttle service to Patong Beach and Downtown Phuket
The hotel is super nice and a good place to relax. Altho it is a little apart from patong, it would be better if you rent a car.

Excellent view with comfort and relax in room facilities. Great pool with nice view and privacy. Friendly staff in every venue including front desk, room service, restaurant & recreation center. Nice free Yoga class, and other activities.
great view and architecture but low service mind and interior maintenance.
Feel so impressed when we arrival in the afternoon. Room has a Nice view and privacy. Also the infinity pool and the restaurant are nice!
Our rooms was not ready before 03.30 pm And the hotel suffer from lack of maintenance

Upon stepping into the villa, I was immediately overwhelmed by a wave of disappointment. The first thing we saw was 2 big trees right in front of the private pool, blocking whatever view there was supposed to be. After entering the villa, I went straight to the bedroom, hoping the view would be better (considering that we had a "sunset view" villa). Again, disappointment. A large portion of the view was of the rooftop of another villa below ours. We did see tiny part of the sea, if that is any consolation. The villa itself was designed nicely, although I do agree with other reviewers that it is the lack of attention to details that fails to make it a 5* resort. When we reached the villa, the lady who walked us through the villa mentioned that bathrobes are not in the room yet, and will be brought later. They did not come as promised, and we had to call to request for them at night. They called us back shortly and told us that they could only send 1 (they probably thought we already had 2, but still asked for more), so we said we do not have a single one here! So okay, they said they will send 2 over. And they sent 2 blankets instead of bathrobes! There were some other points that made the stay disappointing, but the resort still had its redeeming points. The breakfast area was nice, food was decent, and the main infinity pool was lovely (we used their main pool since our private pool was so bad). Overall a decent stay, but there are probably other better resorts out there
Awesome view and environment with high privacy. All staff are nice and helpful. Reasonable price. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.
An amazing experience by all means at the NAKA Phuket

Expansive campus requires hotel transportation to move from hotel room to breakfast, gym, lobby, and beach. Generally the buggy was ready within 1-2 minutes but numerous times the wait time was greater than 15 minutes. I also felt the room types were deceiving and we got a small room with a partial view for the price I expected a private villa. The staff was not willing to accommodate. We also felt the registration staff was much more Rude than the kitchen/breakfast staff. The food was also delicious.
ofcourse
Amazing view outstanding service super romantic couples retreat I recommend this to everyone

Wonderful. Beautiful and very spacious Villas. Made a marriage proposal and the service personnel, especially Amara, was very helpful with a can-do attitude. Excellent, will definitely be back! On-Site problems were fixed quickly too.
Great architecture and design, but the service was not up to standard. Very rude staff at breakfast when my husband showed up one hour early before restaurant opening due to golf trip.

Well, the Naka Phuket is NOT a 5 stars hotel. I spent 2 days there and although I was amazed by the room itself, I am afraid that the level of service is nothing like you would expect in a 5 starts (I know what I am talking about since I spent 5 nights at the neibouring 'The Surin' hotel before spending 2 night at The NAKA. First of all they have a restaurant offering international food but we wanted to try the Thai dishes. What a ;mistake, I had the mussaman curry and I can say that my sister in law that doesn't know how to do an omelette could do a better curry that this. It was tasteless, watery, bland. Also cold and took ages to arrive. It would be ok if we ordered this curry in Greenland but we ordered this that curry in Thailand...THAILAND ! We tried other dishes but they were ALL like this. Also, we ordered a breakfast the day before because we were leaving very early (that we paid for as it was included in the room price) and to our surprise, the following day, there was absolutely no breakfast waiting for us, we were flying somewhere else in ASIA and didn't eat for hours because of there lack of organisation. The level of service at 'The Surin' was definitely to another level. We arrived in the middle of the night and a meal box was waiting for us in the bedroom...Complementary and not ordered ! This is just to give you an example of the poor service we had for the 2 nights/3 days. Definitely not worth the price, Too pretentious !!

The architecture of the hotel is beautiful including the rooms and restaurants. Nice kids club. However, the hotel is built on a hilltop so expect a lot of stairs to reach your villa or other facilities. The air conditioner didn't work well and we had many stairs to our villa so we were replaced with another one with less stairs since we have one child and a baby with stroller. However, this process took some time as the front office manager took 3 hours to do so and we had to call several times

I Stayed at the Naka for 4 nights in the 3-bedroom villa. The space, views and service were incredible. As you pull up to the open air lobby, you will be blown away by the views. The villa was massive, with two floors, three bedrooms, four baths, common indoor and outdoor spaces, and private infinity plunge pool. Awesome space for a family stay. The amenities on site were also great - restaurant offering free extensive breakfast buffet, workout facilities with daily fitness class schedules (option for personal, as well), spa offers the best of services and there is also an onsite store for souvenirs and beach apparel. There is also another sky lounge atop the spa area - you must check this out for a drink/meal as the views are even better than the lobby. The resort is set along a cliff side so you will require a buggy to get from your room to other points within the resort - this service is extremely fast and you will never wait more than 5 minutes to be chauffeured. This was, hands down, one of the best resorts I've ever stayed in, and would not hesitate staying again.

I have stayed at this hotel (1 bedroom villa) for 2 nights for my friend's wedding. The hotel rooms (villa) are completely private. The staff are friendly but when we called for buggy to go down to the restaurant, it took more than 30 minutes to come up to our room. I loved the private pool and the outdoor bathtub.

The overall feel and view was stunning. But, I got the room in the tower and the room was a little underwhelming. Even found a cockroach in the bathroom, and the room also somewhat felt too bare. But, over all, liked the beach and the pool. Because the restaurant was open-air setup, can be too hot without AC.

A very hilly road off the main road between Patong and Kamala, fantastic to get away from everything and everyone. Not somewhere to go if you want to party. We had a great time at the Naka, slept well, ate well, drank well, exercised well, had great adventures! Thanks to all staff at the Naka Phuket.

took 2hours to check in after they finally found our reservation & told us room had been given away ,sigh.locally run & it showed Room (changed twice) still didn't have a good view . Saying all this we would consider staying again ,decent set up if you get the right room & get better check in than we did . Breaky was awesome yet lunch in villa was tasteless .
During night the room was way too dark , can be more brighten , overall a comfortable stay .

I have read reviews of The Naka online before booking. I must agree that the hotel location and architecture are superb, and I love the quiet private location into the hill and on the cliff side. I stayed in 1-bedroom villa with pool and the room was clean with full facilities. If there is 1 complaint, its the service. I ordered room service and had restaurant service. Each order took 1 hour to deliver! We were very hungry and when we enquired on our order to the waitress, she told us that the kitchen is preparing and we have to wait. Though they were apologetic, we were still very hungry from waiting and its frustrating. If you stay at The Naka, you will have serenity and privacy, but you need to look for food outside and be prepared to pay for transport to and fro the hotel (its not cheap).
Very remote area and overpriced. Won't go back there.

During our 7 days stay, nearly we don't need to leave our lovely villa except getting breakfast. Our Villa, West 32/4 is one of the best for privacy. The others are poor for privacy and silence. Hotel facilities are so poor for a 5 star holiday but villa comfort was excellent such as 3 times a day housekeeping and you can find everything such as fresh water, coffee, tea, beers and fruit basket at mini bar and kitchenette everyday. Housekeepers provide clean towels 2 times a day. Private pool and open air bathroom are lovely. Perfect place to get rest especially for couples and honeymooners. Finding a breakfast package prepared for us while trying to reach for a very early flight to hometown after an instant check out process was the peak of our amusement of that lovely holiday settlement. Once again we would like to thank to the Reservation Assistant Manager Ms. Prae. Tip for future customers... bring huge amount of mosquito repellent sprays with you to protect yourself against huge mosquito armies. Good luck.

..the hotel rooms or villas seem to be some sort of work in progress. The lounge chairs in our villa were falling apart (we could not use them at all), closet doors and wood floor looked really washed up and not clean in some cases. The grounds were beautiful and so was the main pool. Uncrowded private beach was a treat for sure. We rented a car having read the reviews re taxi prices to and from the hotel. Over all, we enjoyed our stay.
No flip flop for inroom and outdoor The villa are a little bit dark

Great hotel, great location. Staffs were so friendly and accommodated. Room was clean and has nice amenities in the room with great housekeeping service. Front desk staffs are very attentive. The Meka Sky Lounge has amazing view with great foods and drinks. We will go back for sure!
My wife & I had a private pool villa close to the restaurant and the beach which was awesome. Service was great and highly recommend this hotel.
Amazing architecture. Gorgeous villas.
Was great everything perfect stunning view and great staff!!

Inconsistent service standard. Room not well maintained considering the hotel only opened in 2013. No bedroom slippers, when we asked they sent us grubby looking ones! Too dark as well, fine line between mood lighting and not enough lighting. Admittedly, the architect did a great job, views are fantastic and villas are well positioned but somehow the interior furnishing was lacking. The outdoor tub looks too dirty to be used, and even filled up like a pond during heavy downpours. Food was average, spa was poor. No free shuttle to main towns. Had to pay THB 800 to just get out of hotel to find better food. Phuket has many great luxury hotels, give this one a miss.

Was a good stay ,will stay again if go back,beautiful view placed on hill,villa was very comfortable,restaurant was right in front of beach,n spa experience was just brilliant.In n all a good stay n luvd the hotel very much

Great, location, ambiance and design. Don't be put off by entrance from main road! Staff very helpful and friendly, except on front desk who were less helpful or friendly than they could have been. Food good, but breakfast was missing a bit of quality. Rooms were very good, but finish of workmanship not 100%. Overall very good for region, just missing something to take it into the premier league.
Best hotel if your on relaxing trip,or a beach lover,the view is excellent as the hotel is on hill,rooms are very beautiful,would luv to visit hotel again
Excellent WiFi. Excellent location by the beach. Good to have private pool. Disappointed with the choice of vegetarian food option.
5 stars hotel, likes living in paradise. Staff are fantastic, helpful and politely. Loves to be back again real soon. Very impressed with all services.

Relaxing and comfortable stay. Service was exceptional. Privacy and intimacy were both high on the agenda. Complimentary transport was provided to and from the hotel to Patong Beach. Possible suggestion is to have a later shuttle return service at say 9 pm which would give customers time to have dinner, a few drinks and do a bit of sightseeing and shopping before returning to the hotel. Improvements on the room - understandably there are a lot of insects so better pest control is needed. Ants and other small insects were all over the bath room table and living room. The room is also very dark. More lighting in the living room and corridors should be installed. This gives the guest the option to turn it on or leave it off. In terms of food - there was a great variety of options. Delicious array of western and Thai food on offer. Reasonably priced. Great views from the beach. Thoroughly enjoyed the private pool. TV connection was poor. Channels were very grainy as the reception was weak. There was cable TV but it was not enjoyable having to watch television which had grainy visuals. Did contact the reception but was told that this may be due to the weather. There was no follow up from them. We left it at that.

Amazing place with amazing villas Some with great views (higher up) only fault some staff struggle with English and there are a few small maintenance issues. On the whole heat place and would definitely come back.

This was truly the worst stay in Thailand or anywhere in South East Asia we have ever experienced. From the moment we touched down to find that our confirmed transfer was no where to be seen, to a 3 hour delay before our confirmed check-in time all the way to a no-show transfer home personally guaranteed by the manager, the Naka put Fawlty Towers to shame. And throughout the staff were disengaged, disinterested and hugely disappointing. Save your money and DO NOT STAY here. Plenty of other properties in far better condition with much better service.
The place , staff, service was just amazing. But could use more variety of restaurants and food offered

Great staff, truly beautiful resort. Great food Wifi was difficult on my iPhone 6s but worked well on my Mac. Cheap by western standards, expensive by Thailand standards (twice the price for food and drink)

Very uniquely designed hotel that has great views. Suite layout was distinctive along with private outdoor space with private pool. Service was not up to par with other hotels in this price range, but I would still stay here again because of the uniqueness of the room.

It's a great moment for staying in Naka Phuket due to the following reasons 1.a very private location which allow customer to have a quiet and conformtable relaxation 2. A very efficient Service including room service and internal pick up service 3.a wonderful private pool located exactully next to the room. 4. A very good quality of room service including the delivery need time and quality of food. 5. Wonderful experience of the in-Villa BBQ. Good quality and unexpected good service 6. High standard of language level which make customer to have a good communication among different staff. Meanwhile, there are still room to improve such as the following 1. Too many ant in the room. It may because of the location of the hotel and the environmental condition. 2. Water prove in washroom and bathroom should be increased in order to avoid the broken of the floor since the floor is made of wood 3. Quatity of light in the area of washroom and bathroom should be added in order to have a brighten the area. It's too dark now. 4. Adapted should be ready in room since e-device is very popular in this century. Customer may have one more e-device now. Charging is very important. I will recommend friend to have a stay in this hotel for both honey money or relaxation in case they will visit Phuket. Regards, Louis

We stayed for 6 nights! We had the villa with the beautiful beach facing villa with the private pool. The room was clean, huge and nicely decorated. The timber floor however was a hazard, unsually slippery when one has his or her socks on, I nearly slipped and fell several times but disasters were luckily avoided. Daily room services is execellent, including free replacements of the bar fridge which was something that unexepected but nice. Downside of the stay was that the free hotel shuttles between the Naka and Patong only run three times a day, outside that schedule time, the location is very much secluded, one has to arrange own transport to get to anywhere, including the nearest 7-11 or any stores, which cost some moneys even with good bargaining skill with Tuk-Tuk or the Taxi draviers!!!

The hotel is beautifull!!!! But is in the middle of nowhere!!!! There is nothing to do except what the hotel offer, and if its raining the bar is closed!!!!! And so!!!! The one terrible thing is that people in the hotel who seem to be alwyas helpfull are always trying to rip out your money!!! Fares ( of transportation, tours and food) are always twice or more of what you can find in kamala or phuket!!!! You always feel they are stealing your money!!!!! Transportation to elephant trekking for example the is really 5 min away the charge 600 bath, while an outside tuk tuk charges 200bath and and a meter taxi charges 100bath. Any tour to baches (ex: maya beach) in the hotel is about 4000bath per person while in the towns (phuket) is 1700 bath per person all included!!!!! Is sad that in such a beatifull place you leave feeling every one tried to steal your money!!!! FOR THE HOTEL BEING A TOURIST IS NOT THE SAME AS I WANT TO GIVE MY MONEY AWAY

If we just look at the unit as single one, it looks very nice, but if those are congested all around the whole hillside area, it is another contrast impression. Either you are on a higher level or lower level, you would see the others or be seen easily. So when that outstanding bedroom is right above the others or close to the others, you would feel like your next door neighbour is much too close. The design has then become failed to show what it should be. The hotel seems not to have enough staff. So please would only work in a routine way for a sharp 2pm check in and 12pm check out, and always telling "fully booked". However, I still noticed quite many rooms are not occupied. Yet, they only service one time each day - no turn down service. Buggy service isn't enough either. Also, better take a a morning or noon flight on the check out day so that you don't bother with going to the swimming pool and then to the gym for shower (waiting another buggy to go up hill to the gym). Also, the buggy (actually it's a converted truck) spoiled the unique design of this place. Imagine a truck and also some motorbikes running right in front of your villa or nearby with fume and noise.

This place is absolutely majestic. Arriving at the lobby and looking out over the hotel will take your breath away. Each room is meticulously designed, exceptionally comfortable and phenomenally relaxing. I left the hotel three days ago and have daydreamed about it every day since. Trust me- you've never stayed anywhere like it before.

I went the NAKA for our engagement trip. My fiance loved it the most. due to smoke from indonesia the weather wasnt clear but we still enjoyed the gorgeous view og the NAKA. the related service in Patong was excellent we got served as VIP in patong

Very secluded. Loved the design. Beautiful villas, awesome public pool, restaurants etc. Sky lounge was amazing. Really good food and a million dollar view. I also liked the little private beach of NAKA, with a mini stream coming down the hill into the sea. Come across a lovely little hermit crab on the beach. Spa was nice. Over priced for true massage lovers but def enjoyable experience. Breakfast last till 11 so great for lazy buns like me. And they make really good ice tea! Not perfect. Some of the reviews are very true - expect slow services sometimes, not super clean pools and outdoor bath if you are used to a super urban environment, also expect to see old looking wood decks etc. The location is a pro and a con at the same time. There is literally nothing in walking distance but trees. It's rustic, embracing the nature but with a very modern design at the same time. Overall highly positive. I would love to stay at NAKA again next time I go to Phuket, but also interested to try other resorts.

I was very impressed with the hotel service. I left my passport behind in the safe and was already at the airport but the staff rushed down to the airport in time for me to catch the flight and didn't ask for anything in return! I gave a tip of course but he looked surprised like it was unexpected and just seemed too happy he made it on time for me to catch the flight. Our room also came with daily breakfast buffet which was pretty good. Nice spread of decent quality. Otherwise the food around the hotel is really quite expensive. Cheaper to get a good seafood dinner at patong beach The villa itself was splendid. Exactly like what the pictures show. The bed was so soft and comfortable and I loved how all the curtains could be drawn to create a "glasshouse effect" in the bedroom. And of course the private infinity pool with a beach view... what can I say! It's worth paying for! Only thing I didn't like was the private pool lounge area outside the room had no shelter or umbrella. Otherwise the stay was perfect despite the erratic weather! Pity we didn't get to do any of the sea activities due to weather conditions. Ps the spa was really expensive and it's mucheap cheaper to do massages at patong but we were treated like princesses and it was ALMOST worth the price but I probably wouldn't do it again.more for just experiencing it once.

Phuket was suffering heavy rain during our stay. We have no choice but can only order room service for food. Delivery staff were nice and professional under pouring rain. Only suggestion is the lighting of toilet is rather dim. Room was clean, and we did not suffer any insect problem luckily.

Staff was attentive, food was good and not expensive. But the wine selection is limited and on par with the food's price range. Beautiful view. The only area that needs improvement is maintenance. Burst lightbulbs didn't get replaced, thus some areas are really dim, especially the bathroom.
lovely hotel to have a nice weekend getaway. Helpful and great staffs.
Although Naka Phuket was opened in 2013, it looks like a 5-6 years old Villa.
Staff was attentive, very good assistant manager who helped us a lot. Food can be improved. Very nice private pool, twice the size than most other villas we stayed below.

Positives - The staff were very friendly and helpful in fulfilling any requests we had and even provided a complimentary birthday cake. The room was cleaned twice a day. We had a great view from both the room and private pool although some rooms may not be so fortunate. The mini bar was free. The main pool is by the beach and also provided a great view and is large enough to have a real swim. Negatives - As mentioned in previous reviews there were a few ants in the room, for me personally it was not a big deal. The bath tub is located outside and at the back of the villa, we did not use it once as it looked unappealing. Apart from that everything else about the room was up to par. The beach is private, which is nice, but it is not suitable for swimming as it is very rocky under the water. The hotel provides a shuttle bus service to Patong beach 3 times a day with the last one returning to the hotel at 7.30pm. In terms of distance, it cost us 400baht to get a tuktuk back. As the resort is large and built on a hill, depending on your room, you will most likely need to take a buggy between your room and reception/restaurant/beach etc Most of the time this is not a problem however sometimes we needed to wait 10 minutes or more. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to friends. Considering the size of the room at 180m2 (I think) and the private pool you will be hard pushed to find something similar for the money.

We stayed three nights. The hotel is quite nice, great view, private beach, quiet, pleasant. The included breakfast is quite good, everything you'd want. The staff are polite and friendly, work hard to be pleasant. My sole complaint is that the construction is... cheap? I don't know if that's the right word. But for example, our pool was missing tiles, one of the two sinks in the washroom was clogged, the rain showerhead would leak even when you were trying to use the hosed showerhead, stuff like that. Basically they try to sell the hotel as a five start resort, but really it's four stars. Not a big deal, just a bit too expensive for what you're getting. Free shuttle to patong three times a day. We avoided eating our meals at the hotel because it was stupidly expensive. Luckily we rented a scooter so we could come and go as we pleased. About a ten minute ride to Patong. I won't be making another reservation of this nature. It's just not worth it. Stay at a cheaper hotel and spend more time out and about. It's a better experience.

Good room and pool size for two pp. free drinks in fridge was a plus. Great sea view and quiet enough for chill out. Hotel brekkie and food was particularly good and taste local. Looks quite new still after two yrs. staff speak good english and are very friendly and helpful. Lots of couples stay there and enjoy photo shooting on private beach and dont see kids around perfect! No blue toothed connect to iphone though for music. Gym was quite small without view but good enough for a quick workout. Price matched expection so will go back again.
nice location, nice private beach, nice pool and real nice room. however the services and staff are not at the same standard as the hotel

First and foremost, this is one of the most lovely properties where I have ever vacationed. The views are spectacular. The design of the rooms is fantastic. Literally surprises around every corner like the soaking tub outside of the shower / toilet area of each villa - literally outside and not visible due to the curtains closing the room until we happened to stumble upon it the day before we left. And that is part of my only concern for this property - the service. Upon check-in, features like this should be demonstrated to guests. Service in the restaurant was slow / non-existent at times. Took over 15 minutes and two reminders to get a cup of coffee one morning. Service in the restaurant was much better the last day we were there, to be fair. Hotel only provides limousine service, state that they cannot call a regular cab - their option is more expensive than a cab or tuk tuk. On day of check out, hotel arranged a shuttle for us to the airport at 1pm, and told me they would pick us up at our villa about 10 minutes before - lots of hills, so they provide an efficient golf cart service to get you around areas of the property. At 12:30 received call from front desk asking why we had not checked out. We were told they would send a golf cart in ten minutes - did not arrive until 1pm after having to call twice for assistance. Details like that should not happen at a 5-star resort. Overall, beautiful property, service needs some improvement to meet 5-star standards.
An enclosed paradise. Self contained.

An awesome and different Hotel / Villa / Resort property. Each villa is built on the hill, with bedroom hanging on iron girders. Each villa has its own private Infinity pool, bathtub under the sky and still private. Amazing views, glass walled bedrooms. You cannot walk from your villa to reception or hotel, unless you are Athletic enough to walk hills. The Villa offers buggies 24 hours a day to take you from your private villa to anywhere within the Resort. Rarely it creates problem, like when we asked for buggy during checkout - we got it after 90 minutes, though the reception mentioned had sent earlier Lovely, Awesome, Super serene beach. You can spend a day just wandering around the property, its lovely beach, spa and kids club This property is in a hill with nothing around it - no restaurants, stores etc. So you may need to hire a taxi or ask the hotel to get you one.

This modern architectural villa was located in the secluded corner in Kamala with a beautiful private beach. The biggest disappointment was the services provided by this 5 stars villa, which was pale in comparison than any 5 stars hotel I have stayed in. The staff, especially from the reception, clearly did not display any initiative and proactivness when I asked them whether there were any other alternatives to get to the airport apart from the hotel taxi. The same issue applied when I needed to travel to other parts of Phuket. Apart from these, they were many services related issues and the lack of proper understanding of English language skills which resulted in the poor services. Clearly, proper training is required for the staff in order to achieve a 5 star service rating!
Great secluded location with a private (but a bit rocky) beach. Good service. Lots of ants everywhere. Restaurant, poolside, room, everywhere. Drop a crumb and you're inundated with an ant invasion.

Absolutely wonderful 4 night stay! Very attentive and polite staff, villas were very comfortable and the private pool amazing. There wasn't any construction occurring that affected our stay and I would highly recommend The Naka Phuket if you are wanting relaxation, comfort, peace and quiet.
the kids club is amazing and the lady taking care of the centre is superb! A very big love to her
Great hotel. Would definitely return there the next time we are in Phuket.

We stayed in the 1 bedroom villa. Although it is located close to the beach, the view from our bedroom is still beautiful. Both the private and public infinity pools are very nice. The hotel staff are very friendly and they promptly delivered what we requested to our villa. Breakfast in the morning was great too. Good variety of food and they changed the items every day in our 3-day of stay there. I would definitely come back and stay again, hopefully in a villa higher up the hill.
